articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Islamist group al Shabaab attacks Kenya base used by Kenyan, U.S. forces
articles.description: Somalia's Islamist group al Shabaab on Sunday attacked a military base in Lamu county in Kenya that is used by both U.S. and Kenyan forces, a source and al Shabaab said.
articles.content:
NAIROBI (Reuters) - Somalia’s Islamist group al Shabaab on Sunday attacked a military base in Lamu county in Kenya that is used by both U.S. and Kenyan forces, a source and al Shabaab said. 
“They have attacked Manda airstrip in Lamu, which is just next to t… [+915 chars]

articles.description: EditorsNote: Corrects to Brandon in lede; a few other minor tweaks'
articles.content:
EditorsNote: Corrects to Brandon in lede; a few other minor tweaks 
Brandon Tanev scored at 1:49 of overtime Saturday to give the visiting Pittsburgh Penguins a 3-2 win over the Montreal Canadiens.

articles.title: Samsung Electronics says will unveil 'innovative devices' on February 11
articles.description: Samsung Electronics <005930.KS> said on Sunday that it will introduce new, innovative devices in San Francisco on Feb. 11, with the electronics giant widely expected to unveil its new foldable phone and a new version of its flagship S model.

articles.author: Prak Chan Thul
articles.title: Cambodia building collapse kills 36 people, injures 23 others
articles.description: Thirty-six people were killed and 23 more injured when a tourist guesthouse under construction in Cambodia collapsed, trapping workers under rubble, officials said on Sunday.
articles.content:
PHNOM PENH (Reuters) - Thirty-six people were killed and 23 more injured when a tourist guesthouse under construction in Cambodia collapsed, trapping workers under rubble, officials said on Sunday. 
Officials said rescue operations ended two days after the s… [+1123 chars]

articles.title: Islamist group al Shabaab attacks military base in Kenya's Lamu county
articles.description: Somalia's Islamist group al Shabaab has stormed a military base in Lamu county in Kenya's coastal region used by both United States and Kenyan military personnel, a source and al Shabaab said, but it was unclear whether there were any casualties.

articles.title: Patriots quarterback Brady says 'unlikely' to retire
articles.description: Tom Brady said he was "unlikely" to retire following New England's defeat by the Tennessee Titans in a National Football League wild card playoff game on Saturday.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Tom Brady said he was “unlikely” to retire following New England’s defeat by the Tennessee Titans in a National Football League wild card playoff game on Saturday.

articles.title: Australian Prime Minister Morrison defends bushfire crisis response

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits Mexican state of Oaxaca
articles.description: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck 38 kilometers to the southeast of the city of Union Hidalgo, along the Pacific coastline of Mexico's Oaxaca state, the Mexican seismological service said late on Saturday.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - A strong earthquake struck the southern Mexican state of Oaxaca late on Saturday, near to the Pacific coastline and the neighboring state of Chiapas, prompting security protocols to be activated. 
Oaxaca’s civil protection agency said… [+595 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi non-oil private sector loses momentum in December - PMI
articles.description: Saudi Arabia's non-oil private sector expanded in December at the slowest rate since July, weighed down by slower output and new orders, a survey showed on Sunday.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia’s non-oil private sector expanded in December at the slowest rate since July, weighed down by slower output and new orders, a survey showed on Sunday.

articles.title: Mexico's president says will ask for planned gas pipeline to be rerouted
articles.description: Mexico's President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said that he will ask for a natural gas pipeline being developed by Canada's TC Energy Corp to be rerouted so it does not cut across lands considered sacred by communities in Puebla state.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Body of top Iranian commander killed by U.S. strike in Iraq returned to Iran
articles.description: The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported.
